"Goki- shichidō" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 255. ==History== San'yōdō was one of the main circuits of the Gokishichidō system. It was first established during the Asuka period. Over centuries, the government functions of the Gokishichido became less important. However, the traditional eight regions, including San'yōdō, remained cultural markers. ==Geography== San'yōdō is the southern part of southern Honshū. The region is on the Seto Inland Sea.Nussbaum, "San'in" at p. 817. It has includes eight ancient provinces,Sale, George et al. (1759). The modern national highway, Route 2, the San'yō Expressway, and the San'yō Main Line of the West Japan Railway Company, follow the approximate route of the San'yōdō. ==Related pages== * Chūgoku region * Comparison of regions of Japan ==References== Category:Chūgoku region
